div.pre: 2044 Gildone, 10 km. SE of Campobasso, Samnium, 1946 Burial: 3rd cent. B.C. (Crawford) Contents: AE Neapolis Arpi Roman Rep.: 2 aes grave Disposition: Campobasso D'Amico, Atti del Primo Congresso Internazionale di Preistoria e Protvistoria Mediterranea, pp. 537-38 Crawford, RRCH 26 Crawford presumably had reason to treat this as a hd., though D'Amico says only that the coins were acquired from a countryman; they might, therefore, be site finds.
